instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00164: What is 820-00164? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP1V2_S3: What is PP1V2_S3? PP1V2_S3 is a 1.2v power rail present when the machine is in an S3 suspend to RAM state.
definitions.PP1V8_S3: What is PP1V8_S3? The PP1V8_S3 signal in the MacBook schematic is a power rail that provides a voltage of 1.8 volts during the S3 power state. The S3 state, often referred to as "suspend to RAM," is a low-power mode where the computer saves the session's state to RAM, allowing for quicker wake-up times compared to a full shutdown..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a <SIGNAL>PP1V2_S3</SIGNAL> short
threads.message:
hi this came in with liquid damage , fan still spin, water got around ram chip, <SIGNAL>PP1V2_S3</SIGNAL> is shorted around 14 ohm ,
there's gunk and junk below <CHIP>U2600</CHIP> and a few broken traces, after <CHIP>U2600</CHIP> lifted,  <SIGNAL>PP1V2_S3</SIGNAL> resistant rise to around 350 ohm, is it good value, should I replace the chip from donor then ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a <SIGNAL>PP1V2_S3</SIGNAL> short
threads.message: Get same chip code, doesn't matter from which board.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a <SIGNAL>PP1V2_S3</SIGNAL> short
threads.message:
edit : it was a <CHIP>U2500</CHIP>, not <CHIP>U2600</CHIP>.
well, i tried turning the macbook on without <CHIP>U2500</CHIP> just to see the behaviour of the macbook, only fan spin but no boot
i tried reball u2500manually by tapping with solder, after installing the <CHIP>U2500</CHIP>, still same behaviour..
should i get at least a beep beep sound or what with/without <CHIP>U2500</CHIP> ?
I have <SIGNAL>PP1V2_S3</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>PP1V8_S3</SIGNAL>.
Do i nees to rebuild ALL the traces even if thereâ€™s a same line with good traces?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a <SIGNAL>PP1V2_S3</SIGNAL> short
threads.message:
You must be sure all traces are good, untill chip pads.
Also check the resistors connected to the chip.
